title: Cat. 42  Cocks and Hens, Hôtel Colbert, 1891
publication_title: The Lithographs of James McNeill Whistler: The Digital Edition
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section body" id="body"> 421891Way: 36  
Levy: 61  
Transfer lithograph, drawn on fine-grained transfer paper  
Ink color: black  
Signature: printed butterfly, center right  
One state; image size: 198 × 144 mm  
Number of impressions listed by Way: 8  
Printer: Way  
Watermarks: 69, 133, 139, 151, 166, 191, 192, 273, 274, 280, 309  
Posthumous edition: 36 impressions printed by Goulding on 18 January 1904  
Posthumous watermarks: 18, 19, 37, 50–56, 195, 209, 219–21, 238  
Stone: erased in 1904  
Whistler-Way Letters: 34, 35, 84, 86; apps. I.1, II.3, II.4, III.2, V.1  
Selected Literature: Way, Studio (1896), p. 223  
Lifetime Exhibitions: London 1895–96 (no. 69); London 1898–99? (no. 2002, as Hôtel Colbert, Paris); Chicago 1900b (no. 34a)

Cocks and Hens, Hôtel Colbert is one of three transfer lithographs (cat. 41, cat. 42, and cat. 43) in which Whistler recorded picturesque aspects of the complex of old buildings near the Bibliothèque Nationale in Paris. This print and Hôtel Colbert, Windows (cat. 41) were included in the 1895–96 exhibition at the Fine Art Society where, priced at two guineas each, the brief, sketchlike views failed to attract buyers.

T. R. Way’s (1905) count of eight impressions of the lithograph is much too low and should be at least doubled; the inventory of Whistler’s estate lists five signed and eleven unsigned impression.

Chicago: AIC, ivory wove paper (317 × 201 mm), signed; MWC, ivory laid paper (307 × 206 mm), signed; Palmer, off-white chine (233 × 149 mm) mounted on white plate paper (382 × 280 mm); SC, cream Japanese paper (309 × 208 mm). Glasgow: HAG (9), ivory laid paper (310 × 202 mm), signed; ivory laid paper (323 × 207 mm), signed; cream wove paper (317 × 203 mm); tan Japanese paper (309 × 209 mm); cream Japanese paper (320 × 200 mm); cream Japanese paper (277 × 201 mm); cream Japanese paper (310 × 214 mm); ivory laid paper (312 × 202 mm), signed; cream laid paper (317 × 206 mm). London: BM, cream laid paper (281 × 224 mm). Washington: FGA, cream laid paper (318 × 204 mm); NGA, cream wove paper (317 × 203 mm), signed.

Remarks: Other impressions are found in Brooklyn, TBM; Cleveland, CMA; and New York, MMA.  
Nesta R. Spink, Harriet K. Stratis, Martha Tedeschi

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">During Whistler’s lifetime a variety of titles were used in conjunction with this lithograph: Doorway—Hotel Colbert (letter 34), Cocks, Hotel Colbert (app. I.1), Hotel Colbert—Door (letter 84), Hotel Colbert (Cocks and Hens) (letter 86), The Door, Hotel Colbert, Paris (GUL LB6), and Hotel Colbert, Paris (app. V.1). The related title Hotel Colbert, No. 2 was used to refer to cat. 41 (app. V.1).

GUL LB6; transcribed in MacDonald (1988), p. 40.

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 42, only state. The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of the Crown Family in honor of James N. Wood, 2004.568.

</section>
